name: PF CHANGS Mongolian Beef
ingredients: 2 tsp. veg. oil 3/4 c. dark brown sugar
1/2 tsp. ginger, minced 1 c. veg. oil
1 Tbsp. garlic, chopped 1 lb. flank steak
1/2 c. soy sauce 1/4 c. cornstarch
1/2 c. water 2 large green onions
1. Make the sauce by heating 2 tsp. of veg. oil in a medium sauce pan over low/med heat.
2. Don't get the oil to hot.
3. Add ginger and garlic to the pan and quickly add the soy sauce and water before the garlic scorches.
4. dissolve brown sugar in the sauce, then raise the heat to about medium and boil the sauce for 2-‐3 minutes
5. Remove from heat.
6. Slice the flank steak against the grain into a 1/4 in. thick bite size slices.

8. Dip the steak pieces into the cornstarch to apply a very thin dusting to both sides of each piece of beef.
9. Let the beef sit for about 10 min. so that the cornstarch sticks.

11. Heat the oil over medium heat until it is nice and hot, but not smoking.
12. Add the beef to the oil and saute for just two minutes, or until the beef just begins to darken on the edges.
13. You don't need a thorough cooking here since the beef is going back on the heat later.
14. Stir the meat around a little so that it cooks evenly.

16. Put the pan back over the heat, dump the meat into the skillet for one minute.
17. Add the sauce, cook for one more minute while stirring, then add the green onions.
18. Cook for one more minute, then remove the beef and onions with tongs or slotted spoon to a serving plate.
